content.description: Start the slab fest on some pretty positive crimps to a solid jug.  Now to the business.  Get your feet set for a few committing moves on some tiny crimps to a ledge.  Pull past the ledge (don't look down) to a thin diagonal crack.  Use it to top out!
content.protection: A pad or two.  Use a spotter!  Landing is not great!
content.location: This is just around the corner of the Depression Wall, which is to the right and part of the same formation of the Ultimate Block.  Slabadabadoo is straight up the middle of the slab.

content.description: Sit start using left face hold and right arete.  With the right wall off limits, work your way up into the double arete through the overhang.  Top out before your depression causes you to make a poor decision.
content.location: The Loathing Arete is located on the far right end of The Depression Wall, just past Arete's Syndrome.  Look for the obvious double arete where this rock is separated from the right wall.

content.description: A nice little 5.9ish jam crack on the left side of the Depression Wall (wall that is just right of the Ultimate Wall).
Jump start (unless you're Justin or Soren) to the extremely sharp starting holds on the rail. Dyno up to the right to the jug.
content.protection: Pad, watch out for the slope.
content.location: Near the Center of the Depression Wall.

content.description: Start on Prozac Crack till you hit the horizontal crack.  Move right on slopers and ok feet, the pump builds just as you hit the crux.  Finish on Loathing Arete.  The crux of this is really establishing yourself on coner and then moving around onto loathing arete.  Sending this is an immediate cure for your depression.
content.protection: one pad with a spotter to drag it under you or about six the length of the crack if your alone

content.description: Start with a hold on the face and a fish hook on the arete. With high feet on the face, throw out left to a poor sloper. Work the arete and feet to a desperate crimp that really can only be used for balance. Fire for the jugs and the top out is yours.
content.protection: Pads and friends; good flat landing.
content.location: This is on the Depression Wall, which is to the right and part of the same formation of the Ultimate Block. Arete's Syndrome is on the far right end of the wall, with a giant flake suspending a small boulder in the air to the right.

content.description: So much rock, so few climbs. If that doesn't get you depressed, maybe you're just too happy of a person. Down and around the corner from the Ultimate Block (which is actually part of the same rock formation) lies this beauty of a wall, that currently only hosts 2 or 3 real routes (with a few V0 contrivances on the right end double arete). If it's too much for you to take, go back to the Alien wall, or keep moving along the trail to the rest of the climbing.
